column4: Yay. :) I'm currently on a Command Line Gentoo box, and this thing needs Ubuntu.
Since its got less than 128MB RAM, I am grabbing the Alternate Install CD, whatever that is.
oh ok, what do you need help with it?
right, right. i've used ubuntu so long so I cant' stand the desktop install.
Assuming you use gentoo, I'll assume you're pretty savy. I have a NTFS part, but linux sees it as swap, but everything is there right
No it's any linux box, windows refuses to boot (no error) and other apps seeing it as ntfs
Hmm. That's... very odd. Unfortunately I'm not sure what's going on. Have you examined the partition to verify its actually an NTFS partition?
Well in gparted it comes up as an 82 gigabyte swap partition set to boot
Wow. That's... wtf. It should know its an NTFS partition.
do you think it's a partition table issue?

I'd verify with fdisk that its actually set to NFTS, yes. I'm kinda grasping at straws, I've never seen anything like that. Every box I've had knew that a certain partition was either FAT or NTFS based.
Since multiple boxes think its swap instead of NTFS, I'd say its the partition and not the linux software.
See, with the latest wines I can play all my games (halo, guild wars, cod2, etc)
So yeah, i just wanna vmware itunes
Yeah, when I rebuild my normal PC, I plan to throw wine on and boom, run em.
You own an iPod and use iTunes store to buy stuff, don't you?
I'm more of a banshee person myself, though I heard songbird is good
